title: Fed Adds $104.5 Billion to Financial Markets
text:
The New York Fed added $104.483 billion in liquidity to financial markets Tuesday.

The injection of money to help keep short-term rates from being volatile came in two parts. The Fed intervened with overnight repurchase agreements that saw eligible banks submit $59.483 billion in Treasurys and mortgage securities, in which the Fed accepted all that was offered. The Fed also added money to the financial system with a $45 billion 14-day repo operation that saw dealers offer $47.9 billion in securities.

...
description: The New York Fed added $104.483 billion in liquidity to financial markets to help keep short-term rates from being volatile.
